posts.post_content:
Shenanigans, the Sonjourner, I'd like to call him.   
  
have a [Massacre Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Massacre Wurm), and want to give your opponents more hell than usual? DING! SHENANIGANS, THE SOJOURNER TO THE RESCUE!  
  
Have a [Rune-Scarred Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rune-Scarred Demon) and are obliging to restricted rules? DING! SHENANIGANS, THE SOJOURNER TO THE RESCUE!  
  
I know there are many more white and blue cards with (when it comes to play) abilities, but those are the two that come to mind first.

Posted By: ClockworkSwordfish (4/6/2012 5:56:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I've got to say that this is my favorite planeswalker in existence. So, I run a White-Blue Knight deck, and my friend generally responds with his pet Blue-White-Red control deck, which stars a playset of "Sphinx of Jwar Isle", with not many other permanents. When I finally acquired Venser, and put him in, my friend just chuckled, and mentioned what a pity it was that Venser wouldn't do much against a deck where his only important nonland permanents were shrouded. As a result, I didn't encounter any resistance in getting to 10 counters and setting off the killer -9, at a time when he had a single Sphinx out, and no other permanents. On my next turn, I cast a pair of "Leonin Skyhunter", again causing my friend to laugh. "Okay,", I said smugly, "I'll exile two Islands." At the end of that game, my friend vowed never to be Venser'd again.
posts.html:

And I've actually gotten chance to activate his ultimate. He's just a fun Planeswalker :)

posts.post_content:
I love this man more than is probably healthy. Seriously, those chops are just out of this world. I knew him before I started playing magic, thanks to having gotten the Time Spiral books years ago. I got in touch with my inner squee-ing little girl when I found out he was getting printed as a planeswalker.  
  
He's usually best buds with my [Stonehorn Dignitary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stonehorn Dignitary), but a recent match made me consider a more clunky use for his +2. With it, Venser can flicker himself away.   
  
Now I'm trying to figure out why you'd want to do that.   
  
There's not really any protective value in it, unless you're about to drop [Kederekt Laviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kederekt Laviathan) or a [Planar Cleansing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Planar Cleansing). It doesn't really affect his number of counters positively, unless you have a thing for the number three. After thinking about this, it kinda feels like it goes against Venser's flavor. Being an expert at teleportation magic, you'd think he'd have some use for using it on himself.   
  
Eh, n... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I love this man more than is probably healthy. Seriously, those chops are just out of this world. I knew him before I started playing magic, thanks to having gotten the Time Spiral books years ago. I got in touch with my inner squee-ing little girl when I found out he was getting printed as a planeswalker.

He's usually best buds with my Stonehorn Dignitary, but a recent match made me consider a more clunky use for his +2. With it, Venser can flicker himself away.

Now I'm trying to figure out why you'd want to do that.

There's not really any protective value in it, unless you're about to drop Kederekt Laviathan or a Planar Cleansing. It doesn't really affect his number of counters positively, unless you have a thing for the number three. After thinking about this, it kinda feels like it goes against Venser's flavor. Being an expert at teleportation magic, you'd think he'd have some use for using it on himself.

Eh, n... (see all)

Posted By: Fuminy (12/6/2012 7:57:33 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: [Conjured Currency](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conjured Currency) turns this into a board stealer. Steal the biggest threat first, then exile your own [Conjured Currency](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conjured Currency) and get it back that turn thanks to being able to steal it back with Venser, since you own it. Next turn steal another. Works beautifully with how Planeswalkers can only use one ability once a turn. May as well steal all their stuff while you're pumping him up to be able to nuke something. The best part is that it costs no mana once it gets rolling. Keep a counterspell (or two) and enough mana open and you just have to wait to win the game. You can even steal lands.
posts.html:
